simulation.world.environment.hexagonalMap

Class HexagonalMapVisitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • simulation.world.environment.hexagonalMap.HexagonalMapVisitor

  • public class HexagonalMapVisitor
extends java.lang.Object
    This class allow user to go through a hexagonal map, by the simple call of the nextMap function. This way, it become very easy to iterate maps in an hexagonal disposition.
    Author:
    Lucas SOARES

      Construct the hexagonal map visitor

      void nextMap()
      Go to the next map As the update can take multiple times to be correctly done, we use this function from the outside to be sure update is done

      • setCurrentMap

        Set the current visited map to a new map given
        Parameters:
        map - The map we'd like to put at this place

      • nextMap

        public void nextMap()
        Go to the next map As the update can take multiple times to be correctly done, we use this function from the outside to be sure update is done

      • updateMap

        public void updateMap()
        Update the current map by increase step/counter Be aware this function won't necessarily go to the next map, it'll only increase the current step. Use nextMap( ) for visitor to go to the next map.

      • isNextMap

        public boolean isNextMap()
        Returns:
        if there's another map after the current one
